name: Holiday Inn Thessaloniki

reviews.title: 3.5-star hotel with no luxury elements, a very basic H-I experience
reviews.text: This is not a 5-star hotel as claimed by Expedia or the hotel itself, so that star-rating is very misleading. But honestly, the chain Holiday Inn is supposed to be a 5-star anyways.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed here and thought it was a good choice. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful Sortiri and John in particular. The location was within walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Breakfast was adeqaute but overpriced for what you got. I would recommend a stay there. We only stayed for a stop over for a couple of days.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: The hotel is located in hte center of the city in a very busy street. There was also a big construction site near it, but we haven't been affected. Because we were on our way to Turkey we stayed just a night without breakfast, but we will be glad if we could return again in the near future.The room was big enough, clean and quiet. The staff were very friendly. We recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: This Holiday Inn hotel was pleasant .We had requested a non-smoking room and we were surprised to know that the hotel has a non-smoking floor. A/C did not work that great but the weather was also very hot. Room was small but comfortable. Bathroom had a drain on floor/plumbing smell..had to cover with floor towel....sort of stinky. Small TV but we were able to catch the BBC and keep up with the tour de France. Parking a plus. Bell captain was VERY nice and most helpful. Location is on a very busy street and there is construction across since we stayed on the back side of hotel the noise did not affect us. Breakfast was too expensive. The buffet has lots to offer but the price is way above average. I think more people would part take if the price was lowered. This hotel is a good spot to stay for one or two nights.
reviews.title: Good Location!

reviews.text: I stayed there from Tuesday to Friday on business. No problems, cost 78 euros a night including breakfast, this is probably a corporate rate, and was worth the money. Breakfast was good, plenty to choose from including some local Greek food. Staff helpful all round. Rooms adaquate, mine was just big enough for the furniture and for me to get round it but air con worked well which considering temperature outside was high 30s then it was doing well. Rooms were clean. nothing to complain about at all really.
reviews.title: Average Holiday Inn

reviews.text: Ouside the hotel was a bit seedy with sex shops nearby but 10 mins other way and you are in touristville so no problems. I think the cheap price of the hotel reflects the local area and not the service provided.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Thessaloniki whilst visiting friends. I was probably the only leisure guest in the hotel at that time and the staff was great in accommodating my relaxed stay. The rooms were comfortable and clean but it was the location of the hotel that was the best part of my stay. The staff was friendly and most spoke fluent English.
reviews.title: Great Property with Business Focus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can walk for a few mins from the hotel and arrive at the sea front. The name of this place is Ladadika and this is a very tourist friendly area. There are scores of restaurants, cafes and bars in the area. Do check out the Kitchen Bar which is close to the docks. It is a fantastic place to visit. A 20 minute walk will also take you to the Legendary White Tower of Thessaloniki. The tower has a museum and offers some spectacular views of the city (but includes a lot of stair climbing). Do check out the restaurant next to the White Tower that has fantastic Pork Ribs.
reviews.title: very disapointed

reviews.title: Mould, noise and hard matrasses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there at the end of September and found the room clean and neat but a little hot. We turned on the airconditioner and set it to cool and turned the thermostat to 15 degrees so we could coll it down quickly. Well after 10 minutes the room started to get so hot! When we checked the vent sure enough only hot air was coming out. We went down to the staff and were told there was nothing they could do. I insisted that someone come and check so they eventually sent someone up. They could not speak english but through some hand gestures we eventually got the message across and he proceeded to open the window and then went back down to the lobby. The problem was that the noise from outside was unbearable and we got no sleep. In the morning I spoke to the manager who explained that they only have a central airconditioning system and it was switched on to heat so you can not heat or cool your own room. I would give this one a miss.
reviews.title: Worst holiday Inn I have seen

reviews.text: Of course, Thessaloniki is in no way a center of everything, and most of tourists avoid to stay there, however the city's Holiday Inn hotel could be much better. The hotel is rather clean but, oh God, so old-fashioned and dated that you feel yourself back in 1970s. I have chosen this hotel because I trust IHG chain and because I'm a PriorityClub member, but for my next stay in Thessaloniki I will choose Hyatt Regency or Excelsior hotel (from SLH chain).
reviews.title: The worst of Holiday Inn chain I stayed in!

reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night and would have loved to stay longer. Reception staff was competent, friendly and helpful. My executive room just fabulous, except for the view from the window- small backroad. Everything looked clean and well maintained, TV offered programmes in several languages. Hotel has its own garage in the basement and cost a few Euro. Breakfast was good. Its a 10-15 min walk to the waterfront along a busy street. Noise insulation could have been a little bit better, but I slept well anyway.
reviews.title: Anytime again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed en route to Istanbul, and found this well located to the train station, and a easy walk to most sites in town. I believe we recieved a complimentary upgrade as "Priority Club" members. We had a pleasant, clean updated room, (in appeared as if they were recarpeting, floor by floor while we there) with a decent immaculate bath, and luxury bed and bedding, replete with soft and firm pillows, (and plenty of them), and the included breakfast was great (as were the ladies in the breakfast room) with lots of choices, both Greek and more Western. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful, and accomadated a late check out for us with a smile..much appreciated. We will be back!
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel with great beds and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't let the five star official rating deceive you. The hotel doesn't worth it, it's more like a good, business oriented 4 star hotel, located in a run down area of the city.
reviews.title: Though not worth its 5 star rating, it's still a comfortable, nice place to stay

description: Situated in the heart of the northern Greek port-city of Thessaloniki, the Holiday Inn Thessaloniki offers a superb service, excellent facilities and immediate access to the commercial and cultural centre of the city. Its convenient location at the city center,only 30 minutes from Makedonia International airport, 200 metres from the railway station, one hour from some of Greece's most beautiful beaches and other historical attractions and next to exciting shopping, entertainment and business areas makes the establishment ideal for leisure and business travellers alike.The 177 stylish rooms and suites have been designed to offer convenience, relaxation and comfort to all guests. All rooms enjoy an atmosphere created by the philosophy of custom-made care of the hotel. In order for your stay to be memorable Holiday Inn Thessaloniki suggests 3 magnificient areas within the hotel itself. Begin your day with a rich breakfast or continue with exquisite tastes of domestic and mediterranean cuisine at the Aristotelis restaurant. The Coffee shop constitutes the ideal meeting point where can taste various coffees,beverages and snacks. Enjoy unique cocktails, fresh juices and drinks at the Capitol piano bar every evening.Special events deserve special attention and guests will receive it at Holiday Inn Thessaloniki. Combining full support services and state of the art equipment, the hotel's 5 conference halls, with natural daylight, can accomodate up to 600 people.
